member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.Configuration
member.summary: Global singleton instance of session configuration

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.Instance
member.summary: Returns global singleton instance of session configuration

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsInitialized
member.summary: Returns true when global configuration has been initiatlized via configurationService.Initialize()

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.Workspace
member.summary: The directory where yuniql-based migration project is placed. This is a required property.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.Platform
member.summary: Target database platform. Value can be `sqlserver`,`postgresql`, or `mysql`. This is a required property.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.ConnectionString
member.summary: The connection string to the target database server. This is a required property.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsAutoCreateDatabase
member.summary: When true, automatically creates database in target database server. This is defaulted to false.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.TargetVersion
member.summary: Runs migration only up to the version specified in this property. When Null, it will run upto latest unapplied version.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.Tokens
member.summary: The list of token key/value pairs to repair tokens in each script file.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsVerifyOnly
member.summary: When you run yuniql verify, it checks if all your versions can be executed without errors. It runs through all the non-versioned script folders (except _init) and all migration steps that yuninql run takes but without committing the transaction. All changes are rolledback after a successful verification run. This is defaulted to false.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.BulkSeparator
member.summary: Bulk file values separator to use when parsing CSV bulk import files. This is defaulted to comma ",".

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.BulkBatchSize
member.summary: The size of each batch when performing bulk load. This may not be used in non-sqlserver platforms. This is defaulted to 0.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.CommandTimeout
member.summary: The time it taks to wait for one commend to execute before it expires and throws error. Use this prorty to adjust time out when you expect a long running migration execution. This is defaulted to 30 secs.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsDebug
member.summary: Enrich trace messages with raw sql statements and more verbose diagnostic messages. Use this when you are investigating some failed migrations. This is defaulted to false.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.AppliedByTool
member.summary: Describes the source of migration applied to target database. This is defaulted to yuniql-cli.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.AppliedByToolVersion
member.summary: Describes the version of source of migration applied to target database. This is defaulted to yuniql.core assembly version.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.Environment
member.summary: Environment to target when running migration with environment-aware scripts. See https://github.com/rdagumampan/yuniql/wiki/environment-aware-scripts

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.MetaSchemaName
member.summary: Schema name for schema versions table. This is defaulted to the target data platform's default schema.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.MetaTableName
member.summary: Table name for schema versions table. This is defaulted to __yuniql_schema_version in all target data platforms.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsContinueAfterFailure
member.summary: When true, forces to skip the the last failed script file and run from next available script in the failed version

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.TransactionMode
member.summary: Transaction mode to use in the migration. Valid options are session, version and statement. When session, uses single transaction for entire migration run. When version, each version is executed in one transaction. When statement, no explicit transaction is created for migration run. This is defaulted to session.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsRequiredClearedDraft
member.summary: When true, migration will fail if the _draft directory is not empty. This option ideal when targeting staging/production environment. This is defaulted to false.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.Configuration.IsForced
member.summary: When true, action would be executed. This is required when executing potentially damaging actions such as yuniql-erase and yuniql-drop. This is defaulted to false.

The source that initiates the migration. This can be yuniql-cli, yuniql-aspnetcore or yuniql-azdevops.

The failed script path.

Additional infromation to describe the version executed.
The duration it takes to complete the version in milliseconds

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService
member.summary: Runs migrations by executing alls scripts in the workspace directory.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.IsTargetDatabaseLatest(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the version of target database is equal or greater than local versions

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.GetCurrentVersion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the current migration version applied in target database.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.GetAllVersions(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns all migration versions applied in the target database

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.Run
member.summary: Runs migrations by executing alls scripts in the workspace directory. When CSV files are present also run bulk import operations to target database table having same file name.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.Erase
member.summary: Executes erase scripts presentin _erase directory and subdirectories.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationService.Destroy
member.summary: Drops previously deployed database.

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationServiceFactory
member.summary: Factory class of creating instance of .

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IMigrationServiceFactory.Create(Yuniql.Extensibility.IDataService,Yuniql.Extensibility.IBulkImportService)
member.summary: Create instance of and uses external data services. When targeting PostgreSql or MySql, this is where you can pass the implementation of and .
member.param: Platform specific data service providing compatible SQL statements and connection objects.
Platform specific service provding support for bulk import of CSV files.
member.returns: An instance of and uses external data services.

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.ITokenReplacementService
member.summary: Interface for implementing replacement of tokens in the script using the pattern ${TOKEN_KEY}. Throws exception and fails the migration when some tokens not replaced due to missing token values passed from the client.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.ITokenReplacementService.Replace(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}},System.String)
member.summary: Runs token replacement process.
member.param: List of token Key/Value pairs.
Raw SQL statement where tokens maybe present.
member.returns: SQL statement where tokens are successfully replaced.

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService
member.summary: Interface for implementing service responsible for initializing and managing the local workspace. A local workspace is a directory where yuniql operations are operated from.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService.Init(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the baseline directory structure in the target workspace path.
member.param: The directory path where workspace structure will be created.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService.GetLatestVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the latest version available in the local workspace.
member.param: The directory path when yuniql operations are executed from.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService.IncrementMajorVersion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new major version migration directory by incrementing the latest major version.
member.param: The directory path where yuniql operations are executed from.
File name of sql file to be created.
member.returns: The version created in v{Major}.{Minor} format.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService.IncrementMinorVersion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new minor version migration directory by incrementing tha latest version.
member.param: The directory path where yuniql operations are executed from.
File name of sql file to be created.
member.returns: The version created in v{Major}.{Minor} format.

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.IWorkspaceService.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the baseline directory structure. The following directories are always required to be present in the workspace else the migration would fail. Required folders are _init, _pre, v0.00, _draft, _post, and _erase.
member.param: The directory path where yuniql operations are executed from.

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.MigrationServiceFactory
member.summary: Factory class of creating instance of .

member.name: T:Yuniql.Core.PluginAssemblyLoadContext
member.summary: This is a collectible (unloadable) AssemblyLoadContext that loads the dependencies of the plugin from the plugin's binary directory.

member.name: P:Yuniql.Core.PluginAssemblyLoadContext.PluginPath
member.summary: The location of the plugin binaries

member.name: M:Yuniql.Core.PluginAssemblyLoadContext.Load(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: The Load method override causes all the dependencies present in the plugin's binary directory to get loaded into the HostAssemblyLoadContext together with the plugin assembly itself. The Interface assembly must not be present in the plugin's binary directory, otherwise we would end up with the assembly being loaded twice. Once in the default context and once in the HostAssemblyLoadContext.
member.param: The assembly name to load.
